0.title: Multiple explosions heard in separatist-controlled city in Ukraine
0.article_body: Multiple explosions were heard on Saturday in the north of the separatist-controlled city of Donetsk in eastern Ukraine, news agency Reuters reported citing a witness. The origin of the explosions was not clear. There was no immediate comment from separatist authorities or from Ukraine. The Ukrainian military said a soldier was killed in shelling by pro-Russian separatists in east Ukraine.

1.title: Not a special innings as WI didn't win: Powell on 68*(36) in 2nd T20I
1.article_body: Reacting to his 68* off 36 deliveries in the second T20I between India and West Indies, Rovman Powell said his knock "won't go down" as a "special" innings as the visitors didn't win. Rovman's knock helped West Indies be in the game till the last over while chasing a 187-run target. India beat West Indies by eight runs.

2.title: Imagine the chaos if SRK is called for trial: Gujarat HC on 2017 stampede case
2.article_body: While hearing Shah Rukh Khan's plea seeking quashing of a criminal case against him over the 2017 stampede at Vadodara station that killed one, Gujarat HC said the actor can be asked to apologise instead of being called to trial. "If you want trial to take place...imagine the...chaos that'd be caused even in the courts," HC told the complainant's advocate.

3.title: Reports citing LIC data to claim COVID deaths were underreported are baseless: Govt
3.article_body: The government has said that media reports which claimed that LIC IPO data confirmed "massive" COVID-19 deaths in 2021 are "baseless and not factual". "Claims settled by LIC relate to life insurance policies taken by policy holders for deaths due to all causes," the government added. The reports' interpretation that COVID-19 deaths were underreported is "flawed", the government stated.

4.title: My existence shouldn't depend on my male counterparts: Yami Gautam
4.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam said she wishes to make a place for herself in the industry where her existence is not dependent on her male counterparts. "I don't want to have a holding in a film by working with certain actors only," she told Indian Express. The actress said she wants to win the audience's confidence as a dependable actor.

5.title: Ghaziabad civic body clears 1,50,000 MT legacy waste at Indirapuram site
5.article_body: Ghaziabad municipal corporation has cleared the 1,50,000 metric tonnes (MT) of legacy waste, which was lying at the Indirapuram landfill site, officials said. Ghaziabad Municipal Commissioner MS Tanwar said the corporation is now in the process of clearing the fresh waste dumped at the site in the last one year. Ghaziabad reportedly generates about 1,200 metric tonnes solid waste daily.

6.title: Tunisian President extends state of emergency until year-end
6.article_body: Tunisian President Kais Saied on Friday extended the state of emergency across the country until December 31 of this year, the official gazette said. Tunisia has been under a state of emergency since 2015, following a bomb attack on a bus carrying presidential guards, killing at least 12 troops. The Islamic State had claimed responsibility for the attack.

7.title: Uttar Pradesh government lifts night curfew amid declining COVID-19 cases
7.article_body: Following a drop in the number of coronavirus cases, the Uttar Pradesh government on Saturday issued an order lifting the COVID-19-induced night curfew in the state. Earlier, the Yogi Adityanath-led government had imposed the night curfew in all cities from 11 pm to 5 am. The order was issued by state Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish K Awasthi.

8.title: PM Modi inaugurates Asia's biggest Bio-CNG plant 'Gobar-Dhan' in Indore
8.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday virtually inaugurated the 'Gobar-Dhan' plant in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, which is Asia's biggest Bio-CNG plant. The plant can treat 550 tonnes of segregated wet organic waste and produce around 17,000 kg of CNG per day. PM Modi said work is underway to build such plants in India's 75 major municipal bodies in next two years.

9.title: Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar get married, 1st pic surfaces
9.article_body: Filmmaker-actor Farhan Akhtar and anchor-model Shibani Dandekar tied the knot at Javed Akhtar and Shabana Azmi's Khandala farmhouse on Saturday. The wedding was attended by Anusha Dandekar, Rhea Chakraborty, Ashutosh Gowariker, Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra and Satish Shah among others. Farhan and Shibani have been in a relationship since 2018. It is Farhan's second marriage.

10.title: Female bear enters wedding reception venue with her cubs in Chhattisgarh
10.article_body: A video of a female bear roaming around inside a seemingly empty wedding reception venue in Chhattisgarh's Kanker has gone viral. The bear with her two cubs on her back is seen sniffing around on the stage near the bride, groom's chairs. IFS officer Parveen Kaswan reacted to the video, saying, "They are not happy with the arrangement. It seems."

11.title: 'Can't run him out like that Polly,' Kohli heard saying on stump mic as ball hits Rohit
11.article_body: During the third ball of the eighth over in second T20I against West Indies, Virat Kohli hit a straight shot after which ball hit Rohit Sharma. Kieron Pollard, who was fielding at mid-wicket, came to pick the ball and joked around with Rohit Sharma after which Virat was heard saying on stump mic, "Can't run him out like that Polly."

12.title: India to host International Olympic Committee Session in 2023 after 40 years
12.article_body: India on Saturday won the right to host the 2023 International Olympic Committee (IOC) Session in Mumbai. It'll be the second IOC session in India, with the country last hosting an IOC session in 1983 in Delhi. "It is time to write the future of sport and ignite our potential with the spirit of Olympism," said IOC member Nita Ambani.

13.title: Air India pilots land plane with ease in UK amid Storm Eunice; video viral
13.article_body: A video showing Air India pilots landing a plane with ease at UK's Heathrow Airport amid Storm Eunice has gone viral on social media. The clip was a part of the livestream of planes' landings and takeoffs at the airport by 'Big Jet TV', a YouTube channel. The commentator could be heard saying, "Very skilled Indian pilot there."

14.title: POCSO Act not for teens' romantic affair: HC on bail to man who 'married' 14-yr-old girl
14.article_body: Allahabad High Court granted bail to a man accused under the POCSO Act for eloping and impregnating a 14-year-old girl. The court said POCSO Act didn't intend to bring within its scope the cases where teenagers are involved in dense romantic affairs. The couple, who eloped in 2019, got 'married' at a temple and stayed together for two years.

15.title: Neighbour kills woman after trying sexual assault, stuffs body in sofa in Thane
15.article_body: The Thane Police has arrested a 25-year-old man, Vishal Ghavat, for allegedly killing his neighbour Supriya Shinde and stuffing her body in a sofa-cum-bed at her residence earlier this week. Police said Ghavat allegedly killed her after she resisted sexual assault. Ghavat had even accompanied Shinde's husband to the police station when he went to file a missing person's report.

16.title: British diplomat shares pic from wedding with Indian man, says 'Incredible India'
16.article_body: Rhiannon Harries, a British diplomat, tweeted a picture from her wedding with an Indian man. Harries is Deputy Trade Commissioner (South Asia) and works in New Delhi. "When I arrived in #India...4 years ago, I had many hopes & dreams...But never did I imagine I would be meeting...the love of my life...I found such happiness in #IncredibleIndia," she wrote.

17.title: US-based Hindu group responds after Trudeau accuses protesters of 'waving Swastikas'
17.article_body: US-based Hindu group, HinduPACT, has responded after Canada PM Justin Trudeau and New Democratic Party (NDP) leader Jagmeet Singh accused protesters of "waving Swastikas" during truckers' protests. HinduPACT urged Trudeau and Singh to not conflate "Swastika" with the "Hakenkreuz", the Nazi symbol. "We believe this misrepresentation will lead to hate cries against Hindus and Sikhs," the group said.

18.title: I can feel his presence all around me: Bappa on dad Bappi Lahiri
18.article_body: Bappa Lahiri, speaking about his late father and musician Bappi Lahiri, said, "I can feel his presence all around me. I just can't see him anymore." "[He was] always generous and warm to everyone including strangers," he added. "Our home was an open house. Anyone could drop in anytime...many struggling musicians came home for meals whenever they wanted," said Bappa.

19.title: Veteran Kannada actor 'Kala Thapaswi' Rajesh passes away aged 89
19.article_body: Veteran Kannada actor Rajesh, popularly known as 'Kala Thapaswi', passed away at the age of 89 due to age-related issues on Saturday morning. The actor had been hospitalised since February 9 in Bengaluru. While Rajesh was the actor's stage name, his real name was Vidyasagar. He began his career as a stage artist and appeared in over 150 films.

20.title: Film on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj announced on his birth anniversary
20.article_body: On Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's 392nd birth anniversary, Anand Pandit Motion Pictures, Eros International, Legend Studios and Ravi Jadhav Films announced a film about his childhood. The film, titled 'Bal Shivaji', will be directed by National Award-winning director Ravi Jadhav. It will span across Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's life from 12 to 16 years.

21.title: Rajiv Kapoor's last film Toolsidas Junior to clash with Big B's Jhund in March
21.article_body: 'Toolsidas Junior', starring Sanjay Dutt and late actor Rajiv Kapoor, is set to release in theatres next month. The Mridul Mahendra directorial will hit the screens on March 4. 'Toolsidas Junior' will clash with Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund' at the box office. Ashutosh Gowariker and Bhushan Kumar, producers of 'Toolsidas Junior', hosted a special screening of the film on Thursday.

22.title: I try to focus on the present, go with the flow: Deepika Padukone
22.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, while talking about her acting process, said, "I take each day, each scene as it comes." "I don't like to overcook things. My attempt is to always focus on the present and go with the flow," the actress told ANI. Talking about her film 'Gehraiyaan', Deepika stated it has been her most 'visceral' experience as an actor.

23.title: BSF rescues Bangladeshi girl who crossed border to escape father
23.article_body: BSF has rescued a 15-year-old girl from Bangladesh who crossed the international border and entered West Bengal to escape her father earlier this week. The girl claimed that her father beats her regularly for no reason and that she didn't want to return home, a senior BSF official said. The girl has been handed over to a child welfare association.

24.title: Bengaluru woman accuses neighbours of using witchcraft; 5 booked
24.article_body: Five people of a family were booked after a woman, who's their neighbour, accused them of using witchcraft and wreaking misfortune on her family in Bengaluru. According to the complainant, CCTV footage reportedly showed one of the accused throwing lemons at her husband's factory, that's in the neighbourhood. She claimed the accused beat her and her son on being questioned.

25.title: Two Army jawans martyred in Shopian encounter in J&K
25.article_body: Two Army jawans belonging to 1 Rashtriya Rifles were martyred during an encounter at Chermarg in the Zainapora area of Shopian in Jammu and Kashmir on Saturday. Both the jawans, identified as Santosh Yadav and Chavan Romit Tanaji, died due to fatal gunshot wounds, police said. An encounter broke out between terrorists and security forces at Shopian on Saturday morning.

26.title: Owner & manager booked after fire at Noida spa kills 2
26.article_body: A case was registered against the owner Anirudh Yadav and manager Jayprakash Yadav after a fire broke out at a spa in Noida Sector 53 on Thursday, killing two people. "The spa management...ignored safety guidelines and didn't install fire safety equipment in premises," SI at Sector 24 police station said. Another officer said Jayprakash fled after the fire broke out.

27.title: Delhi Police rescues man threatening to die by suicide near India Gate
27.article_body: Delhi Police on Friday rescued a 32-year-old man who tried to die by suicide near the India Gate. The man, a native of Madhya Pradesh who works at a factory in Haryana's Panipat, had dressed up as Mahatma Gandhi, police said. He said that he was upset with the factory owner who was not paying his workers, police added.

28.title: Metro link between Noida airport to Delhi airport to cost ₹15,000 crore
28.article_body: The proposed Metro corridor linking the upcoming Noida's Jewar airport to Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport will cost around ₹15,000 crore, an official said. The DMRC has suggested a 66 km Metro corridor to connect the Jewar airport to New Delhi Metro station from where it will connect with Delhi's Airport Express line to reach IGI Airport.

29.title: Delhi man hires 3 men, tries to kidnap doctor for money to pay loan
29.article_body: A man hired three robbers and attempted to kidnap a woman doctor at gunpoint in Delhi, according to reports. However, when her husband raised alarm, the accused persons fled. The man was reportedly visiting the doctor for his children's treatment for the past 10 years. He needed money to pay his cab loan and, therefore, he decided to abduct her.

30.title: Girl's semi-naked body found in Delhi's Burari; accused absconding
30.article_body: Dead body of a girl, who was allegedly strangulated was found in Delhi's Burari on Friday. As per police, the absconding accused had reportedly invited her to his home when his wife was away. "His wife had gone to a relative's house and when she returned home...she found the girl's body on the bed in a semi-naked state," police said.

31.title: Any EU sanctions on Russia should not hit energy sector: Italy PM
31.article_body: Italian PM Mario Draghi said any sanctions that may be imposed on Russia by the European Union if it invades Ukraine shouldn't include energy sector. Italy imports over 90% of its gas supplies, with Russia being a key supplier. However, Draghi added the government is looking into other possible gas supplies if imports from Russia are hit due to conflict.
